elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1. CITY SQUARE, COLOGNE. 1589.
A DISTANT BELL IS TOLLING SOMEWHERE. A CROWD CHANTS “Bring Him Out! Bring Him Out!” AN AVALANCHE OF BOOING AS THE
APPEARS. SHOUTS OF “Murderer!” AND “Monster!” ETC... A
BEATS SHARPLY ON A DESK.
Order! There must be order!
FX: THE BOOING CONTINUES. THE GAVEL BANGS AGAIN.
Order! Or I'll clear the square!
FX: MORE SHOUTING. A WEREWOLF SNARL, WHICH TURNS INTO A
ROAR, THE TERRIFIED CROWD GOES QUIET.

Stubbe Pieter, on this twenty-eighth day of October in the year of our Lord God fifteen hundred and eighty nine, I do condemn you to public execution for sorcery and the lewd villainies and diverse murders which you have committed in shape of a great wolf.
FX: THE CROWD MUTTERS.
Let first your body be broken on 4 wheel and your flesh be torn from your bones. Afterward your head will be struck from your body and your careass burned to ashes.
VERY PREGNANT PAUSE.
(DEEP AND MOCKING. CLOSE IN AT THE MAGISTRATE’'S EAR) Will you dance for me, Magistrate?
Hold... him!
Shall I set the whole of Cologne dancing to my tune?
Hold him down!
STUBBE GROWLS, MANHANDLED ROUGHLY.
CINTONING CLOSE BY) Have mercy on us, oh God. Lord have mercy, Christ have mercy... etc.
Take him away. Let God’s justice be done.
(SHOUTING TO CROWD) Say your prayers, Lutherans. You've lost your faith. You’re nothing but cattle - bound to my will!
FX : THE CROWD ARH STARTING TO SHOUT AGAIN.
Take him from this place. And God have mercy on his soul.
(LAUGHING AS HE IS DRAGGED AWAY) Never absolve me! I can never rest! Never! I stalk the Earth for eternity!
FX: HE GIVES A MIGHTY WOLF HOWL.
FADE
SCENE 2. ROSA CAIMAN’S AUDIO DIARY
FX: CLICK AS A 21ST CENTURY AUDIO RECORDER SWITCHES ON.
ATMOSPHERE, BUT A BIT TINNY.
(ON PLAYBAGK) Grandpa? This is me, Rosa. I’m gettin’ out now.
FX: MICROPHONE “BUMPS” AS SHE JUGGLES IT.
Gotta get this diarized. That’s crazy, ‘cos there's no one to listen, but I gotta do it anyhow, cos if I don’t, none of them'll

know if I done what I’m gonna do. Grandpa? I should’ve laid you in a canoe and pushed you out on the current. But you know I can’t do that, ‘cos there's been no river for too many moons. So you gotta wait. I buried you in the ol’ creek bed - hope it ain’t too dusty. Maybe the river’ll come back some day. Then it'll wash you down where the ghosts of the forest spirits are waiting for you. I put flowers where I dug you down... and rocks on top so the dillos can’t dig you up. The guys from the Mission came by in the air jeep again, but I hid in the water tower. Think they want to send me to the city now you’re gone. But someone’s gotta stay. Gotta prove who I am. (LAUGHS) S'‘pose if I do that, they'll say I'm a man. Head of the tribe... Hey, yeah, I gotta...
FX: RECORDER CLUNKS OFF. (BEAT) FX: CLUNKS BACK ON AGAIN.

(WHISPERING CLOSE. SHE’S FRIGHTENED) Gotta go, Grandpa. I heard them out beyond the ranch-house. Way off, but I can't stay longer. Like you said, can’t stay here. Soon be a fat moon again and there'll be nowhere to hide from the future. When the Loups- garoux (Loo garoo) come prowling, we have to hunt them before they hunt us.
FX: RECORDER CLUNKS OFF.
SCENE 3. DOM PEDRO MONORAIL STATION, RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL, 2080-ish.
(IN PORTUGUESE) Bom dia. Isto Estacao Dom Pedro. O centro da cidade velha. Va em frente... (FADES UNDER...)
FX: TARDIS ENGINES MATERIALISING - WHICH TELEPATHICALLY
TRANSPOSES THE LANGUAGE INTO ENGLISH FOR US.

(IN ENGLISH) Welcome to Rio. All new arrivals please have passports and identity implants ready for inspection. Under Amazonian State law, it is an offence not to display your id implant within the city. If you have no implant, report to the Lmmigration Registry Office immediately.
FX: A STREET-BAND STARTS PLAYING A SAMBA. IT MINGLES WITH
TRAFFIC OF AIR CARS.
SCENE 4. ILEANA'S APARTMENT
FX: DISTANT TRAFFIC (WE’RE MEANT TO BE ON A BALCONY.
Senhora, a delivery for you.
More flowers?
FX: RUSTLE OF CELLOPHANE.
Thank you, Inez.
From another admirer? Jorge perhaps? Or Mr Choudhry? [A: Just the usual admirer.
FX: OPENS THE CARD, A MAWKISHLY SENTIMENTAL TUNE.
Thank you for reading this paperfree card. No sees were harmed in the making of this product. Your greeting reads:
(A SPEAKING CARD - ELECTRONICALLY TREATED) To Senhora de Santos. Ileana, your eyes flash like night wings in the old forest. How soon before our breath mingles in the twilight under the
trees? I await your call.
FX: SHE FLINGS DOWN THE WRAPPED FLOWERS,
Anton Lichtfuss. Cut flowers from a would-be cutclaw.
He's very devoted, Senhora.
And that’s all he will be. Yapping round me like an
excited chihuahua. Inez, you'd better put the flowers in water before he arrives and is insulted.
Yes, Senhora.
FX: A WINDOW SLIDES SHUT, CUTTING OUT THE CITY.
The bulletins say there’s been another killing.
Another?
On Ipanema beach this time. The Policia blame the wild dogs.
That's the third in as many days. This city starts to smell of death. I knew it was a mistake to come here.
But we always come for Carnaval (Carn-a-val), Senhora.
That was my late husband’s idea. He loved the
crowds and the music. They’ve always set my teeth on edge. I’d go now, but for Victor’s sake.
I thought your son looked better today.

That’s just the day light. It’s the nights that take him the worst. Doctor Hayashi insists there’s some change. But I’m not convinced. I can’t see any change at all. And I don't think those straps will hold him much longer.
FX: DOOR BUZZ.
Who's that at this time? Not the chihuahua already?
FX: CLICKS ON SCANNER.
There’s no one outside, Senhora.
Go and look anyway.
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN. INEZ GOES OUT.
Well? (PAUSE) Inez? (PAUSE) Inez?
(COMING BACK) There’s this... (DISTASTE) package. A box. It smells of...
Be careful. Put it down.
FX: PARCEL PUT DOWN.
Dirty and wet. Mr Lichtfuss would never leave
somewing like that. ey CUNEASY) I don't think so.
The smell. It’s old... something rotting.
Yes. (BEAT) Let me see the card.
FX: HANDLES THE CARD. A MAWKISHLY SENTIMENTAL TUNE.
Thank you for reading this paperfree card. No trees were harmed in the making of this product. Your greeting reads:
(ELECTRONICALLY TREATED) A gift to the merchant’s daughter.
ILEANA GASPS.
How many fat moons since J pulled you from the snow?
FX: ILEANA CLOSES THE CARD QUICKLY.
Senhora? Who is it? What's in the box?
(VERY AFRAID) Don’t touch it!
(SLOW REALISATION) It’s leaking blood...
Call Hayashi, And the others. I want them here, Inez.
Senhora.
T'll attend to Victor. You get our things packed. We're
getting out of Rio now.
SCENE 5. THE SUMMIT OF THE CORCOVADO (THE CHRIST STATUE)
FX: GENERAL CHATTER OF TOURISTS. AN AIR CAR BUZZES PAST &
INTO THE DISTANCE.
Hold still.
FX: CAMERA CLICKS.
There you are.
Thank you. Thanks very much.
My pleasure. Have a nice day.
(APPROACHING) Doctor, that’s the fourth picture you've taken for someone else.
People come a long way for this view, Turlough.
That's a reason why we came too. Remember?
(DEEP, SATISFIED BREATH) Yes... They say the
Corcovado Statue is the best place to see Rio. Amazing, isn’t it? And now the smokes of the twenty twenties have lifted... Did you get your moqueca (mokayka)?
The fish and coconut stew? Not exactly.
Mm?
I think he saw me coming. He wanted twice the amount you gave me.
Actually I think you're supposed to haggle.
He kept going on about ident credit implants. All he’d sell me was this manky-looking burger.
Yes, well, tomato sauce can hide a multitude of sins.
That’s what I'm banking on. What I really want to see is the Carnaval.
It'll be a good three days before it starts in earnest. Can you survive on the loca) cuisine till then?
I might have to spend some time on a hot, sunny Rio beach to compensate.
Ah. I think at this date, the beaches may be rather
overrun by shanty towns. Displaced indians, overflows from the favelas. That sort of thing.
Not really what I had in mind.
(TO HIMSELF) No, somehow I thought not.
What about you, Doctor?
(CAUGHT OFF GUARD) Me?
Yes, what do you really want?
Well, I’m not sure I could really... A lot of things, I suppose.
Oh, come on. How long have you been travelling?
There must be something you've always searched for.
Perhaps... (BEAT) But I was once told that I'd know
when I found it.
And have you?
What do you think? (CHEERFULLY CHANGING THE SUBJECT) Still this view is quite spectacular. Last time I was here the statue of Christ wasn't even built.
No?
That would have been around seventeen hundred, and the bay down there was full of clippers.
The chief trade being in gold and sugar.
And slaves. Like most triumphant enterprises, it had its rotten underbelly. (T'URLOUGH SPLUTTERS)
Ugh! This burger is disgusting. (SPITS)
Thad a feeling it might be.
No one can eat this. Ugh. It’s all greasy and gritty.
(CALLS) Here, you.
FX: A DOG BARKS.
‘You mutt. D’you want it? Because I don’t.
Turlough, I’m not sure if that’s advisable.
Here you are. Go on.
FX: DOG BARK. DEVOURING, CHOMPING NOISES.
That's it. At least someone appreciates it. The skinny- looking mongrel was eyeing me up as soon as I bought the burger.
Still I don’t think we should encourage him. Where do you want to go now?
Anywhere, Doctor. As long we can get away from it all.
CKNOWING) Get away from it, Turlough? Or get away with it?
(GOOD NATURED) Probably a bit of both, Doctor.
Yes, I think I’d go along with that. (MOVING AWAY)
There’s a parade down there in the city. Shall we take a look? TURLO! S You can see that far? Yes. I'd like that. (REALISES HE'S ALONE) Doctor? Well, wait for me!
SCENE 6. ILEANA’S APARTMENT. Victor’s room.
(ILEANA AND DR HAYASHI , MIDDLE-AGED AND RATHER PRECISELY VOICED, ARE STRUGGLING WITH VICTOR, ILEANA'S INVALID SON.)
FX: VICTOR MOANS REPEATEDLY, WITH MORE THAN A HINT OF AN
ANIMAL IN PAIN.
(STRESSED) Victor, calm down. Quietly, now. We won't hurt you.
FX: VICTOR REACTS ANGRILY.
Senhora, you must hold him still.
I'm trying to! He’s not used to strangers, Hayashi.
(TO HER SON) Victor, it’s alright. Don’t struggle. Mother's here.
FX: VICTOR GIVES A LOW GROWLING GROAN.
There. That’s better. Nothing to be afraid of. Doctor Hayashi's here to help. No one's going to hurt you.
Just one jab.
FX: VICTOR SNARLS IN PAIN.
What are you doing, you idiot! (TO VICTOR) It's
alright. Victor. It’s alright.
FX: VICTOR’S GROWLING SUBSIDES. ; I
That's better. Administering his medication is proving more dangerous than I anticipated.
FX: VICTOR IS BREATHING DEEPLY, MORE LIKE A SLEEPING ANIMAL.
(QUIETLY) He’s sleeping again. Next time be more careful with my son. Come through to the lounge. I have to discuss our departure.
Senhora, this is ridiculous.
FX: VICTOR'S BREATHING FADES AS THEY LEAVE THE ROOM. A
CLOSES.
I mean it, Hayashi.
Your son's condition is already critical, if you de- stabilise him further, I may never be able to effect a change in his... nature.
We have to leave Rio.
You cannot afford to take him out in public like that.
There is no limit to what I can afford. If necessary your payment can be reviewed.
No, no. You misunderstand. My equipment, my assistant... all these are difficult to move.
You brought them here. You can re-establish them elsewhere. It will be quiet. With no distractions.
HAYASHI. But why this sudden change? I must know. Where are you going?
FX: DOOR OPENS.
(ENTERING) Senhora.
Herr Lichtfuss.
I came immediately. Are you safe?
Yes, yes, Anton. For the moment. Inez is packing. We leave the city at eighteen hundred hours.
So soon? Tell me what has happened. You've had a warning.
Yes. (AWKWARDLY) But I can’t talk...
HAYASHI. Good afternoon.
(SHARP) Who's this...?
Herr Lichtfuss, this is Doctor Matsuo Hayashi.
The physician that you've acquired to treat Victor.
You said “warning”. Does this mean, Senhora, that you have received some sort of threat?
How much do you understand, doctor?
I have the Senhora’s confidence. How else could I attempt to cure her son?
Cure! That's the last thing we want. Deana, I thought
you'd abandoned these fantasies.
They are not fantasies. But we must leave Rio now.
Have no fear, Senhora. I will not abandon you or your son. Knowing what I know, I can’t imagine you’d ever let me walk free. So, where will we be flying to?
Flying?
Flying? Whatever gave you that idea?
FADE
SCENE 7. MOUNTAIN TRACK
THE DOCTOR AND TURLOUGH WALKING
FX: FOOTSTEPS ON ROUGH GROUND
(STRUGGLING TO KEEP UP) Slow down, Doctor. I didn’t think you planned to walk down?
I thought you'd enjoy the fresh air.
I thought we had return tickets on the cog-train.
Only singles.
Well, shouldn’t we stick to the road at least? Hang on, they don’t do singles.
Returns are for tourists.
I thought we were tourists.
Really? Yes, I suppose you could look at it like that.
Unfortunately you spent the last of our tenable currency on that burger.
SILENCE APART FROM FOOTSTEPS.
That dog’s still following us.
dust ignore it. It'll soon get bored. You see over to the north east beyond the space ports? That’s where the Amazon rain forest used to be.
Used to be...
Up until about twenty years ago.
(INCREDULOUS) You mean they finally burnt it all.
They didn't have to. The Amazon was so intensively
farmed, its eco-system completely caved-in. The so-called lung of the world turned into a monumental dust bowl. All the unique wildlife - birds, animals, plants - was decimated.
But couldn’t anyone try to stop it? Surely someone...
Lots of people. There was nearly a war. But by then the Earth governments had a new toy. The untapped resources of the Moon and the asteroid belt to exploit.
So nobody cared. Humans are so stupid.
When you’ve studied humans as long as I have, it’s hard not to find them quite endearing.
I certainly didn’t intend to study them this long.
No? Well, I suppose they can get a bit wearing at
times. All those questions. And they never seem to learn from their mistakes.
ANOTHER SILENCE WITH WALKING.
That dog's still behind us.
CKEEPING GOING) I know. And a couple more have tagged along.
FX: DOG BARKS, A LITTLE WAY OFF.
And more to the right.
Just keep walking. Don’t run.
FX: MORE DOGS BARK ON EITHER SIDE.
It's turning into a pack. What do they want? They’re after food.
I haven't got any more food.
I don't think they’re that fussy, Turlough. If we can just get to the road...
A DOG BOUNDS CLOSE AND SNAPS AT THEM.
Look out!
THE DOCTOR SHOUTS IN PAT.
FX: CHORUS OF BARKING CIRCLES THEM.
Are you hurt?
Just a little demoralised. They’re trying to drive us into a dead end. Look out!
FX: ANOTHER DOG MAKES A SNARLING RUN. HE SNAPS AT
TURLOUGH.
TURLOUGH YELLS.
FX: MATERIAL RIPS. AND THE DOG BACKS OFF AGAIN.
Turlough?
I never liked this jacket anyway. What do we do?
Try to divert them. There’s an old story about throwing the baby out of the sledge to stop the pursuing wolves.
I threw them a burger, Doctor, and that only brought more of them.
Then give me a hand with this branch.
FX: THE DOCTOR STARTS PULLING AT A BRANCH.
We'll have to fight our way out as best we can.
The wood’s tinder dry.
Exactly. I don’t suppose you’ve got any matches.
Sorry.
(GOING THROUGH POCKETS) Now where did I put
that magnifying glass?
FX: A CHORUS OF GROWLS DRAWS LN AROUND THEM.
Doctor? I don't think there’s time for that.
(RESIGNED) Alright. Keep your back to the bushes and stay close to me. That way they’ve only got one line of attack. Try to tackle one at a time...
FX: THE DOGS ARE DRAWING IN.
Ready, Turlough.
Ready, Doctor.
Here they come,
FX: THE HOWL OF A DISTANT WOLF. THE OTHER DOGS STOP.
What’s that?
FX: THE HOWL AGAIN. CLOSER. THE DOGS SCARPER.
They’re going.
Come on!
What happened? Where did they go?
We're not staying to find out. Come on.
FX: THEIR FOOTSTEPS START TO STUMBLE AWAY.
Something frightened them off.
There’s the road. You were right. We should never have left it.
But they just ran.
Just keep going or we’ll miss that parade.
Don’t tell me then. I don’t want to know anyway.
No, Turlough. I don’t think you do. Come on!
FX: WOLF HOWL AGAIN. FADE INTO DISTANCE.
SCENE 8. ILEANA’S APARTMENT
FX: THE DISTANT WOLF HOWL.
Anton, did you hear?
Right across the city. It’s another warning. He’s marking out his territory.
The Grey One. So many years since I heard that voice, I hoped it might be never again. I was praying it might be just the wind howling in the trees
You're cold.
It chills me.
Poor Ileana.
I thought the ocean might be a barrier to him. How
long have I tried to deny all that darkness, knowing it would always return? Slinking in, the way the moonlight always finds a crack in the shutters.
He must get past me first.
No. We can't make a stand against him. Who knows how powerful he’s grown?
I shall challenge him. Most powerful or not...
Don’t be a fool. You don’t know him.
But I will.
(BEAT) I was afraid Victor would wake. Above all else, I have to protect him. That's why we must get out of Rio now.
With that cutclaw doctor? Is your son really so ill?
There’s no change. Why doesn’t he change? (BEAT)
Until Hayashi came I thought everything was lost. But he’s an expert.
A meddler.
He has to be trusted. And we can’t stay here. Where's Inez?
We can't run forever, Ileana. The others won't follow.
They'll do as I tell them. Even you, Lichtfuss. For all
the attentions you pay me, you must accept that the old world has changed. I won't sway my decision for anyone. I’m still the leader. And my word is still our law.
SCENE 9. STREET IN RIO.
FX: THE CARNAVAL PARADE EXPLODES OUT AT US. A SALSA BAND,
DRUMS, WHISTLES.
(THE DOCTOR & TURLOUGH, JOSTLED BY THE CROWD, BOTH MUCH
JOVIAL, AND RAISING THEIR VOICES TO HEAR EACH OTHER.)
Doctor! Over here! You can get a better view.
(PUSHING THROUGH) Excuse me. Can I just...? 'ma Doctor. Can I get through please? Thank you. (A CARIOCAN YELP.) Sorry.
Look at those bird and animal masks. Some of them are almost alive.
Fascinating. (BEAT) So is this what you had in mind?
Much more like it.
And the business with the dogs...? I apologise...
It’s alright. Don't worry. Look at the dancers now! And this isn’t even real Carnaval yet.
Glad you Like it.
Ido, Thank you, Doctor. (THOUGHTS IN A SPIN)
Look! Look at the colours on that seashell outfit! Is it all made of flowers? The whole thing must be twenty foot across.
No, not really. It’s amazing what they can do with computer graphics these days.
(NUDGE, NUDGE) It’s amazing how little they can cover with so much
Atavistic expressions of the inner human self...
I'd call it downright revealing.
Positively bacchanalian. But what do you expect from
a population that spends the rest of the year hunched over computer screens?
FX: SHRILL SYNCOPATED WHISTLE BLOWN BY A PASSING REVELLER.
And a happy Shrovetide to you too!
(LAUGHING) Or maybe humans are just plain Earthy.
(ALMOST LAUGHING) Yes. Yes, indeed. But preferable, I'm sure, to the straight-laced rigours of public school.
Never again, Doctor. Now this is when you see what humans are really like.
Oh, please, not too philosophical, Turlough. Not today.
(NOTICES A CONVENIENT DISTRACTION) Ah... Good heavens, I’m not entirely sure how that stays up.
Skill, Doctor.
Or art...
Yes. But I wouldn’t stare quite so much if 1 were you.
Re
A JINGLING SAMBA GIRL DESCENDS.
Aye. You want to dance?
Gomme on, let’s dance.
Er... no, really. Thank you.
Yes. Let’s dance. Do the samba.
TURLOUGH IS LAUGHING.
No, it’s very kind of you...not just now, really...
Everybody dances at Carnaval. Come on. Dance with me. I show you how.
No, erm thank you... please, no.
Go on, Doctor! Get in there!
(CLAPPING HER HANDS) Yes. We samba all the way to the Sugarloaf and back again.
No. Please let go. I’m sorry, I’m saving myself for the big day. Another ee perhaps...
Dent be such a coward, Doctor. You can.... (HE
STUITERS AND SHIVERS.)
FX: THE CROWD AND BAND NOISE FADE AWAY. SOME SORT OF AIR
IS HEARD SLOWLY APPROACHING.
Turlough? What's the matter?
TusLove™: (WITH DIFFICULTY, AS IF HE’S FREEZING) What is it’?
Don’t move. Something’s coming through the crowd.
I must... get back. .
FX: THE SILENT CROWD STARTS TO SHUFFLE.
No, no, don’t go with the crowd. Turlough, listen to me.
We have to move. Have to let it through.
FX: THE DRONE OF THE AIR CAR PASSES CLOSE BY & FADES INTO
THE DISTANCE.
Turlough? Listen. I have to follow that car.
TURLOUGH GROANS
Just stay here. I'll be back.
(MUMBLING) Don’t go, Doctor. Wait for me. (HE
AGAIN)
FX: AN AUDIBLE & MENACING AURA RISES.
Something else coming. Who’s that?
FX: SOMETHING GROWLS MENACINGLY LIKE A THREATENED DOG OR
WOLF.
Those eyes. Black and gold. Don't look. Don’t look.
FX: THE AURA CONTINUES.
CHARDLY DARING TO ASK) Who are you? (BEAT) Don't look at me like that.
Good day to you, young stranger. What fierce eyes you have.
Like you then, aren't I.
STUBBE GIVES A LOW GROWL
What do you want?
Got any food for a hungry wanderer? (BEAT) No?
Perhaps 1 was wrong. I was told there was a young fellow with food to throw away. A hunter, I thought. But you have the lean, hungry look of @ common jackal.
(SWALLOWS) Leave me alone.
For the moment. There was a forest here once, but the cutclaws tore it down and set us wolves
(SARCASTIC) Oh yes, of course they did.
And we run fast, young stranger.
Ive seen better wolf masks in third rate horror films.
STUBBE GROWLS. HE COMES IN CLOSE. TURLOUGH SHIVERS.
Once we have a scent, we never lose it. Don’t stray
too far from the path. Because I’ll be waiting.
FX: THE AURA FADES.
(EXHAUSTED) Doctor, where the hell have you gone?
FX: THE CROWD STARTS TO STIR. BUT THERE’S NO MORE MUSIC.
(APPROACHING) Turlough! There you are. (ON AN
TRAIN OF THOUGHT) That hover limo. The crowd parted like the Red Sea, to let it through.
(QUIET) I don’t... really remember...
Interesting. Probably couldn't help yourself. Could have been some sort of mass auto suggestion. Even a basic mstinctive fear, driving you back. You look cold.
Yes.
You've dropped your jacket.
Sorry.
Couldn't see who was inside the car though. The
windows were polarised. I wonder why it was pushing through the erowd when all the traffic lanes are thirty feet overhead? Mind you, if
it’s moving at ground level that makes it easier to follow. (SUDDENLY NOTICES.) Turlough? You do look very cold.
(RALLYING A LITTLE) Something else came through. After you'd gone. ;
I didn't see anything. Was it following the car?
It came right up to me.
Really. ;
It kept growling. And it was tall... with a mask like a
wolf and burning gold eyes. (WISHES HE HADN’T THOUGHT THIS) At least I think it was a mask.
Did you speak to it?
(SHARP) No.
Pity. (BEAT) That car was heading for the old Dom Pedro station.
Where we left the TARDIS.
Nasty thoughts are like buses, Turlough.
Mmm?
You don’t see one for ages and then a whole army come along together. Come on!
FADE
SCENE 10. ESTACAO DOM PEDRO CONCOURSE
(JORGE, WHO IS OLDER, MEETS ILEANA AND HER PARTY — LICHTFUSS, INEZ & HAYASHI)
FX: A HOVER CAR DRAWS UP AND SETTLES. THE DOOR OPENS.
(APPROACHING) Senhora. I was starting to worry.
The Carnaval crowds delayed us, Jorge, but they may help muddy our tracks. Where’s the train?
It's all prepared and programmed. Inez. Herr
Lichtfuss. Are we all here?
If we stand about, we'll attract attention. We must keep my son out of sight.
He’s still sleeping. Jorge, help us with the hover- gurney.
(A DEEP GRUMBLING GROWL OF DISTASTE) Are these the physicians?
Doctor Hayashi.
And this is my assistant, Juro.
They come with us. I told you this already.
(COLD) This way, Senhora.
FX: FOOTSTEPS AS THEY CROSS THE CONCOURSE
Inez, where's Kanu Choudhry? I thought he’d meet us.
(UNCOMFORTABLE) Mr Choudhry is not coming.
You didn’t tel me that. (TO ILEANA) Senhora? Has he finally slunk away, tail between his legs?
It’s something I'll explain to you later.
(SNEERS) Not in front of the cutclaws..
Never say that again, Lichtfuss! Never ever! Any
more whining and I’ll..
FX: THE FOOTSTEPS FALTER.
What’s that? (DEHP BREATH) Do you catch it?
(BREATH) What is it?
(THEY’VE CAUGHT A SCENT WHICH SENDS THEM INTO A BIZARRE AND SLOW REVERIE - THE MUSIC COULD EMPHASISE THIS.)
JORGE. It’s like nothing I’ve ever...
Ancient... a scent like... stillness.
Like coming snow...
No, no. Like breaking ice on the rivers in spring.
The scent after the lightning before the thunder.
Or fields after rain.
And the oldest forests. Under the dark fir trees...
(ANGRY GROWL) Almost... unearthly... HAYASHI. (URGENT) Senhora. Senhora, we should move.
